result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor H Hernandez Sandoval was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Jordan K. ($662.87) and to MKE Carpenters District Council ($893.28) to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with Jordan K. or his residence. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. LAST 30 Days are Stayed for use at agent's discretion. To commence 03/10/17 by 6pm.
To be completed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Victor H Hernandez Sandoval in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Shelley K. makes statements.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Jordan K. or his residence 
____50 Hours of Community Service
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $662.87 to victim Jordan K. (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                         $893.28 to MKE Carpenters District Council (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  50 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence March 10, 2017 by 6:00 p.m.  - LAST 30 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations***
filed on 3/6/17 by Attorney Mark Kershek
